dict.string: This utility will rebuild your Apple Mail app's envelope database from scratch. This can take time. Use it when you Mail is missing items or appears to be corrupted. If Mail is just slow you might want to try the PS-Mail_Optimizer instaed.
This will will Quit your Mail app and then rebuild your Apple Mail app's envelope database from scratch. Click "OK" to continue, or click "Cancel" to exit.

#!/bin/bash
# Apple Mail envelope rebuilding script # Parts based on the Bash Script of Paul Galow https://github.com/pbihq/tools # Which was based on the AppleScript by Brett Terpstra http://brettterpstra.com/2015/10/27/vacuuming-mail-dot-app-on-el-capitan/ # Start script clear echo "Apple Mail Database rebuild started..."
# Define variable(s) os=$(sw_vers -productVersion)
# Close Apple Mail AppRunning=$(pgrep Mail) if [[ -n $AppRunning ]]; then osascript -e 'quit app "Mail"' fi
# Check for OS X version if [[ $os = 10.11.* ]]; then mailversion="V3" else mailversion="V2" fi
#Get User Name userName=$(stat -f "%Su" /dev/console)
# Remove envelope db for resynchronization/rebuilding /bin/rm -rf /Users/$userName/Library/Mail/$mailversion/MailData/Envelope\ Index* &> /private/tmp/MailRebuilding.log /bin/rm -rf /Users/$userName/Library/Mail/$mailversion/MailData/ExternalUpdates.storedata* &> /private/tmp/MailRebuilding.log error=$(cat /private/tmp/MailRebuilding.log)
# Create success/error message if [[ -z $error ]]; then error=0 echo "Done." else echo $error fi
# Set exit code if [[ "$error" -ne "0" ]]; then logger "Apple Mail Database Rebuild failed." exit 1 else logger "Apple Mail Database Rebuild finished." exit 0 fi
